info.title: Proto Mining API
info.description: The Proto API serves as a means to access information from the mining device and make necessary adjustments to its settings.

miner_ip.description: IP address or hostname of your Proto mining device

tags.name: Mining
tags.description: The mining endpoint group allows for control and configuration of mining functionality.

tags.name: System
tags.description: The system endpoint group exposes information and actions related to the overall miner system.

tags.name: Network
tags.description: The network endpoint group provides information on the network configuration of the miner.

tags.name: Errors
tags.description: The errors endpoint group provides active system errors (severity level errors or warnings) to surface to the UI.

tags.name: Pools
tags.description: The pools endpoint group allows users to configure the list of pools the miner will connect to.

tags.name: Cooling
tags.description: The cooling endpoint group provides information and control over the cooling system of the miner.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: The authentication endpoint group contains functions related to changing the password, and other authentication-related actions.

tags.name: Hashboards
tags.description: The hashboards endpoint group provides information related to the various hashboards or ASICs on those hashboards in the system.

tags.name: Hashrate
tags.description: The hashrate endpoint group provides historical hashrate information for the entire miner, individual hashboards, or individual ASICs.

tags.name: Temperature
tags.description: The temperature endpoint group provides historical temperature information for the entire miner, individual hashboards, or individual ASICs.

tags.name: Power
tags.description: The power endpoint group provides historical power information for the entire miner or individual hashboards.

tags.name: Efficiency
tags.description: The efficiency endpoint group provides historical efficiency information for the entire miner or individual hashboards.

tags.name: System Information
tags.description: The system information endpoint group provides status and configuration details about the mining device system.

tags.name: Hardware
tags.description: The hardware endpoint group provides information about the physical hardware components of the mining device.

tags.name: PSUs
tags.description: The PSUs endpoint group provides information about the power supply units in the mining device.

tags.name: Fans
tags.description: The fans endpoint group provides information about the cooling fans in the mining device.

tags.name: Time Series
tags.description: The time series endpoint provides unified access to historical data for multiple metrics including hashrate, temperature, power, and efficiency in a single request.

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: The telemetry endpoint provides current (real-time) values for all metrics available in the timeseries endpoint, with support for brief and extended detail levels.

tags.name: System Tag
tags.description: The system tag endpoint group provides a simple way to set and retrieve a custom tag for the mining device.

get.description: The get pools endpoint returns the full list of currently configured pools.

200.description: The list of pools was successfully returned.

post.description: The post pools endpoint allows up to three pools to be configured, replacing the previous pool configuration.

requestBody.description: Pool configuration data for creating or updating pools

201.description: The pool configuration has been successfully created.

get.description: Get configuration for a specific pool by ID

200.description: Configuration for a single pool was returned.

put.description: Using this pool configuration endpoint, users can edit the properties of an existing pool.

200.description: The pool configuration has been successfully updated.

delete.description: Delete a specific pool configuration by ID

204.description: The pool configuration has been successfully deleted.

post.description: Used to test a pool connection

requestBody.description: Pool connection configuration data for testing connectivity

200.description: Connection test passed.

put.description: The password endpoint allows users to set a password during onboarding

requestBody.description: Password data for setting the initial device password

200.description: Password successfully set.

put.description: Change the current password to a new password. Requires the current password for verification.

requestBody.description: Current and new password data for changing the device password

200.description: Password successfully changed.

post.description: Authenticates a user using a password and returns a JWT access and refresh token pair.

200.description: Successful login, returns JWT tokens.

post.description: Validates and blacklists JWT tokens, effectively logging out the user.

requestBody.description: JWT tokens to be invalidated during logout

200.description: Successful logout.

post.description: Validates the provided refresh token and returns a new JWT access token.

requestBody.description: Refresh token data for generating a new access token

200.description: Successful refresh, returns a new access token.

get.description: The system endpoint provides information related to the control board including OS, software, and hardware component details.

200.description: The mining device system information.

get.description: Get system statuses

200.description: The onboarded status of the mining device.

get.description: The mining endpoint provides summary information about the mining operations of the device. This includes device level hashrate statistics, overall miner status, and current power usage and target information.

200.description: Mining status information has been successfully returned.

get.description: The mining target endpoint returns the current power target in watts that the miner is controlling for.

200.description: The mining target value was successfully returned.

put.description: The mining target endpoint can be used to set a target power consumption for the miner. Once set, the mining device will operate to consume as close to that amount of power as possible. In the event that the device is unable to maintain its temperature within the allowed range, it may scale down and use less power.

requestBody.description: Target power consumption configuration for the mining device

200.description: The mining target has been successfully updated.

post.description: The start mining endpoint can be used to make the device start mining, into account the current power target of the system.

202.description: Mining start command has been accepted.

post.description: The stop mining endpoint can be used to stop the device from mining, going into a minimal power mode with only the control board running.

202.description: Mining stop command has been accepted.

post.description: The reboot endpoint can be used to reboot the entire system.
The locate system endpoint can be used to flash the indicator LED on the control board to assist in finding the miner.

parameters.name: led_on_time
parameters.description: The duration in seconds for which to turn on the LED, with a max value of 300 seconds. If not specified, a default value of 30 seconds will be used. Requests made while the LED is on will be ignored.

202.description: The mining device's LED has started flashing for the specified duration

get.description: The logs endpoint provides the most recent log lines from a given source, either OS, pool software, or miner logs.

parameters.name: lines
parameters.description: Number of log lines to return from the tail of the log, up to a maximum of 10000 lines. Defaults to 100 lines.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of logs to fetch. Defaults to miner software logs.

200.description: Successfully returned linux system, miner pool interface, or MCDD logs.

post.description: Initiates a check with the update server to determine whether a new version of the miner software is available. This request does not perform a download or installation, only a version availability check.

202.description: The mining device has successfully started system update check.

post.description: Initiates a system update of the miner software. This will download the update and automatically install it once the download completes.

202.description: The mining device has successfully started the update process.

put.description: Uploads a firmware update file to the device. This endpoint will also install it once the upload completes.

requestBody.description: Firmware update file to be uploaded to the device.

file.description: The firmware update file to upload (.swu format)

200.description: The firmware update file has been successfully uploaded.

get.description: The get ssh endpoint returns if SSH is enabled or disabled on the control board

200.description: The SSH status was successfully returned.

put.description: The put ssh endpoint enables/disables SSH on the control board

requestBody.description: SSH configuration settings for enabling or disabling SSH access

200.description: The SSH status was successfully updated

get.description: The get UNLOCK endpoint returns current lock status of the control board.

200.description: The lock status was successfully returned.

put.description: The put UNLOCK endpoint execute device unlock on the control board when correct password is used.

requestBody.description: Unlock password configuration for device unlock operation

200.description: The control board successfully performed device unlock.

get.description: The hashboards endpoint provides information about all of the hashboards connected to the system, including firmware version, MCU, ASIC count, API version, and hardware serial numbers.

200.description: All hashboard information

get.description: The hashboard status endpoint returns current operating statistics for a single hashboard in the system based on its serial number.

200.description: Successfully returned the statistics information for the specified hashboard.

get.description: The hashboard status endpoint returns current operating statistics for a single ASIC on the specified hashboard in the system based on serial number and ASIC ID.

parameters.name: asic_id
parameters.description: The id of an ASIC to provide statistics for.

200.description: Successfully returned the statistics for the specified ASIC on specified hashboard.

get.description: The hashrate endpoint provides miner-level historical hashrate operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested miner-level hashrate data.

get.description: The hashrate endpoint provides hashboard-level historical operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested hashboard-level hashrate data.

get.description: The hashrate endpoint provides ASIC-level historical hashrate operation data.

parameters.name: asic_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ASIC to provide hashrate information for.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested ASIC-level hashrate data.

get.description: The temperature endpoint provides miner-level historical temperature operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested miner-level temperature data.

get.description: The temperature endpoint provides hashboard-level historical operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested hashboard-level temperature data.

get.description: The hashrate endpoint provides ASIC-level historical temperature operation data.

parameters.name: asic_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ASIC to provide temperature information for.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested ASIC-level temperature data.

get.description: The power endpoint provides miner-level historical power operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested miner-level power data.

get.description: The hardware endpoint provides information about the hardware components of the miner. This includes hashboards, power supplies, and fans.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested hardware information.

get.description: The get power supplies endpoint returns the full list of currently configured power supplies.

200.description: The list of psus was successfully returned.

get.description: The power endpoint provides hashboard-level historical operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested hashboard-level power data.

get.description: The efficiency endpoint provides miner-level historical power operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested miner-level efficiency data.

get.description: The efficiency endpoint provides hashboard-level historical operation data.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested hashboard-level efficiency data.

get.description: The cooling endpoint provides information on the cooling status of the device, including mode and current fan RPM.

200.description: Cooling status successfully returned.

put.description: The cooling configuration endpoint allows the user to control the fan mode.

requestBody.description: Cooling system configuration settings for fan control

200.description: The cooling configuration has been successfully updated.

501.description: Not implemented error - mode specified not supported/implemented.

get.description: The network GET endpoint provides information related to the network configuration of the miner including IP address, gateways, and MAC address.

200.description: The network information.

put.description: The network PUT endpoint allows the user to change the configuration of the miner between DHCP and a static IP.

requestBody.description: Network configuration data to update miner networking settings

200.description: The network configuration has been successfully updated.

get.description: The errors endpoint provides alerts to be surfaced on the UI with different severity levels such as errors or warnings. This endpoint should be polled periodically to surface any issues that arise during mining operation.

200.description: Array of currently active errors.

example.message: Temperature threshold exceeded on hashboard HB001

get.description: Retrieve the current system tag value.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the system tag.

schema.description: The system tag value as any non-null JSON value (string, number, boolean, object, or array)

put.description: Set or update the system tag value. Accepts any non-null JSON value (string, number, boolean, object, or array). Maximum size is 10 KiB when serialized.

requestBody.description: The tag value to set as any non-null JSON value

schema.description: Any non-null JSON value (string, number, boolean, object, or array). Cannot be null.

200.description: The system tag was successfully updated.

201.description: The system tag was successfully created.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid tag format or null value.

413.description: Request entity too large - tag exceeds maximum size limit.

204.description: The system tag was successfully deleted. No content is returned.

get.description: Get the current system telemetry enabled status.

200.description: Successfully returned the telemetry status.

requestBody.description: Telemetry configuration settings for data collection

200.description: The telemetry configuration has been successfully updated.

post.description: The time series endpoint provides unified access to historical data for multiple metrics and levels. It allows querying hashrate, temperature, power, and efficiency data for miner, hashboard, ASIC, and PSU levels in a single request with flexible time ranges and aggregation options.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested time series data.

get.description: Returns current telemetry values. The 'level' parameter is a comma-separated list that controls which data types are included. If not specified, defaults to 'miner'. Note: 'asic' implicitly includes 'hashboard' since ASIC data is nested within hashboards. Examples: no level param (miner only), ?level=hashboard (hashboards only), ?level=asic (hashboards with ASIC data), ?level=miner,asic,psu (all data).

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of data types to include (e.g. ?level=miner,psu,hashboard). If not specified, defaults to 'miner'. Options: miner (miner-level aggregated data), hashboard (per-hashboard metrics), psu (per-PSU metrics), asic (ASIC-level data within hashboards, implicitly includes hashboard).

schema.description: Data types to include in response. Defaults to 'miner' if not specified.

200.description: Successfully returned current telemetry data

miner.summary: Response when level=miner: Only aggregated miner-level metrics

hashboard.summary: Response when level=hashboard: Includes miner-level and per-hashboard metrics

asic.summary: Response when level=asic: Full detail including miner, hashboard, and ASIC-level metrics

psu.summary: Response when level=psu: Only PSU metrics

all_data.summary: Response with level=miner,hashboard,asic,psu: Full detail including miner, hashboard (with ASIC data), and PSU metrics

mienr_hashboard_and_psu.summary: Response with level=miner,hashboard,psu: Includes miner-level, per-hashboard, and per-PSU metrics

get.description: Returns information about all PSUs including firmware update status and available firmware updates.

200.description: Power supply information with firmware update status retrieved successfully.

post.description: Schedules a PSU firmware update. This command enables the PSU update service so that the update will automatically run on the next reboot of the miner. Use the `force` parameter to bypass scheduling checks and allow re-flashing the same firmware version.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force update even if already scheduled and bypass version checks during execution

202.description: The PSU update has been successfully scheduled to run on next reboot.

Error.description: Error information with code and message details

NotificationError.description: Notification error information with source and details

ErrorListResponse.description: Array of notification errors for system error reporting

CoolingConfig.description: Cooling system configuration for fan control modes

mode.description:
Parameter to define the cooling mode.  Modes:
 - Off: Fans will be set to off for immersion cooling.
 - Auto: Fans will be controlled based on miner temperature.
 - Manual: Fans run at a specified percentage of their maximum speed.

speed_percentage.description: Fan speed as a percentage of maximum RPM (valid range: 0-100). Used only when mode is Manual.

MiningTarget.description: Mining target configuration for power and performance settings

balance_bays.description: If enabled, will keep power evenly distributed across bays to balance power phases.

MiningTargetResponse.description: Response containing current mining target configuration

Pool.description: Mining pool configuration with connection details and priorities

id.description: Each pool has a unique ID from 0 to 2, with 0 representing the highest priority and 2 representing the lowest priority.

priority.description: Connection priority for this pool. Lower numbers are higher priorities, with 0 being the maximum. Duplicate priorities are not allowed.

status.description: The status field indicates the state of the mining pool. An "Idle" status indicates that the pool is available but not currently in use (due to priority). An "Active" status means that the pool is currently active. A "Dead" status indicates that the mining device is unable to establish a connection with the pool.

protocol.description: The protocol being used for communication with the mining pool.

accepted.description: The number of shares that have been accepted by the mining pool as valid solutions to a mining problem.

rejected.description: The number of shares submitted by the miner to the pool that were not accepted because they did not meet the required difficulty level or other criteria.

invalid.description: The number of shares the pool interface rejected due to being too low difficulty (did not forward to the pool).

notifys_received.description: The number of notify messages (new jobs) received from the pool.

works_generated.description: The number of works that were generated from the job notify messages.

blocks_seen.description: The number of mined blocks seen during mining (not necessarily found by miner).

current_works.description: The current number of works in use by the miner.

current_difficulty.description: The current difficulty from the pool.

best_difficulty_share.description: The difficulty of best share submitted to the pool.

last_share_difficulty.description: The difficulty of the last share submitted to the pool.

last_share_time.description: The time (Unix epoch seconds) of the last share submitted to the pool.

difficulty_accepted_shares.description: The total difficulty of all accepted shares by the pool.

difficulty_rejected_shares.description: The total difficulty of all rejected shares by the pool.

hashrate.description: Hashrate calculated over different time windows. This field provides a flexible array format for future extensions.

PoolsList.description: List of configured mining pools with their settings

PoolResponse.description: Response containing a single pool configuration

PoolConfig.description: Array of pool configurations for creating or updating pools

HashboardStats.description: Statistics and status information for a hashboard

AsicStats.description: Statistics and performance data for an individual ASIC chip

id.description: Unique identifier assigned to each ASIC located on a hashboard, starting from 0.

row.description: Physical row location of the ASIC on the hashboard.

column.description: Physical column location of the ASIC on the hashboard.

freq_mhz.description: The frequency of the ASIC measured in megahertz.

temp_c.description: Current temperature of the ASIC in celsius

hashrate_ghs.description: The current hash rate of the ASIC, measured in GH/s.

ideal_hashrate_ghs.description: The expected hashrate determined by the clock frequency of the ASIC, measured in GH/s.

error_rate.description: The number of times that the ASIC produced an incorrect hash or an error during a specific period of time.  Error Rate (%) = (Number of incorrect hash / Total number of expected Hash) x 100%

AsicStatsResponse.description: Response containing statistics data for a specific ASIC chip

The performance mode the miner will operate in. Modes:

TimeSeriesRequest.description: Request parameters for time series data query

start_time.description: Start of the time range in ISO 8601 format

interval.description: ISO 8601 duration for the time interval between data points. If not specified, auto-calculated based on time range.

levels.description: Array of level configurations. Each object specifies a level type, fields to retrieve, and optional indexes.

List of data types to retrieve for hashboard level

values.description: Array of values where index corresponds to ASIC index

average.description: Average temperature value of all temperature sensors on PSU

PsuFieldType.description: Available field types for PSU-level data
